keyMoments.title: Rumbar Pirates Meet Baby Laboon
keyMoments.description: Flashback shows the Rumbar Pirates sailing in the West Blue 50 years ago when they discovered a baby whale following their ship.
keyMoments.significance: Establishes the origin of the crew's relationship with Laboon and sets up Brook's 50-year promise.

keyMoments.title: Rumbar Pirates Play Music for Laboon
keyMoments.description: The crew performs music together to cheer up the sad baby whale, establishing their bond through song.
keyMoments.significance: Shows the crew's musical nature and their compassion. Music becomes the foundation of their relationship with Laboon.

keyMoments.title: Rumbar Pirates Accept Laboon as Companion
keyMoments.description: The crew accepts the baby whale as their companion and Brook names him Laboon.
keyMoments.significance: Formalizes Laboon's relationship with the crew and begins the promise that would last 50 years.

ship.name: Unknown
ship.description: The Rumbar Pirates' ship, shown in flashback sailing through the West Blue 50 years ago

dissolution.circumstances: The crew was wiped out by disease in the Florian Triangle, with only Brook surviving due to his Devil Fruit power (revealed in later episodes)

ideology: A musical pirate crew known for bringing joy and music wherever they traveled. They befriended Laboon and promised to return to him after their journey through the Grand Line.
significance: Brook's former pirate crew who made a promise to return to Laboon 50 years ago. Their story is central to Brook's character and his decision to join the Straw Hat Pirates.
